Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Lousy \Lous"y\, a. 1. Infested with lice. [1913 Webster]
2. Mean; contemptible; as, lousy knave. [informal] [1913 Webster]
Such lousy learning as this is. --Bale.
3. Very bad; as, to feel lousy; to do a lousy job. [PJC]

lousy adj 1: very bad; "a lousy play"; "it's a stinking world" [syn: {icky}, {crappy}, {rotten}, {shitty}, {stinking}, {stinky}] 2: infested with lice; "burned their lousy clothes" 3: vile; despicable; "a dirty (or lousy) trick"; "a filthy traitor" [syn: {dirty}, {filthy}] [also: {lousiest}, {lousier}]
